thread.title: RNC video: Biden was Dems' last hope
thread.title_full: RNC video: Biden was Dems' last hope | Washington Examiner

author: Gabby Morrongiello
title: RNC video: Biden was Dems' last hope
text:
Now that Vice President Joe Biden has decided to forego running for president, the Republican National Committee is asking Democrats, "What now?"
With Biden out, Democrats "last hope is gone," claims a video released Wednesday by the RNC.
According to the RNC, the vice president was the only candidate capable of saving Democrats from nominating Hillary Clinton. The former first lady has been plagued by a handful of issues since launching her second presidential bid, including declining favorability ratings and a federal investigation into her sharing of classified information from the private email server she kept as secretary of state.
Related Story: http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/article/2574118/ "Democrats' backup? Joe Biden," the video asks as soundbites of pundits addressing Clinton's woes play onscreen.
  Border agent: Illegals 'know that they will be released' "What we have right now is essentially a catch-and-release policy."
By Pete Kasperowicz • 10/21/15 1:30 PM Earlier Wednesday, RNC Chairman Reince Priebus described Biden's decision as "a major blow for Democrats, who now will almost certainly be saddled with their unpopular and scandal plagued front-runner Hillary Clinton."
"Vice President Biden was the most formidable general election candidate the Democrat Party could have fielded, and his decision not to challenge Hillary Clinton greatly improves our chances of taking back the White House," Priebus said.
Top Story GOP lawmakers: Has EPA fired anyone for toxic mine spill? Lawmakers pressed the agency on whether anyone has been held accountable for the 3-million-gallon spill.
By John Siciliano • 10/21/15 1:59 PM
